newsitem.title: UK: Copper, aluminium stay firm in late Ldn.
newsitem.headline: Copper, aluminium stay firm in late Ldn.

text.p: Copper and aluminium prices held gains in late inter-office activity after soaring on Thursday on the London Metal Exchange (LME) on tightness that traders saw developing around certain delivery dates.
Three months delivery copper ended the kerb $46 a tonne higher at $2,017 and was bid at $2,016 by the time Comex ended at 1900 GMT.
At that hour aluminium was also assessed just firmer from the end of the kerb when it had stood $33 higher from Wednesday at $1,466.50. This was a two-month high and the day's peak.
Traders said the late drive higher in copper prices coincided with a further widening in the cash/threes backwardation to over $60 from below $50 on Wednesday.
This seemed to signal another sizeable drawdown in LME stocks on Friday.
